name: auto-recover
desc: if true then Qorus will automatically recover any sessions that did not terminate normally

name: daemon-mode
desc: if true then Qorus will launch in the background

name: max-log-files
desc: sets the maximum number of old log files to keep when rotating log files

name: system-pool-minimum
desc: sets the minimum number of datasources in the system omq pool

name: system-pool-maximum
desc: sets the maximum number of datasources in the system omq pool

name: verbose
desc: sets verbose level

name: max-retries
desc: sets maximum number of retries before a step receives status 'ERROR'

name: max-async-retries
desc: sets maximum number of retries before a step with ASYNC-WAITING receives status 'ERROR'

name: recover_delay
desc: sets delay between automatic recovery attempts of RETRY steps/segments in seconds

name: async_delay
desc: sets delay between automatic recovery attempts of async-waiting steps in seconds

name: detach-delay
desc: sets workflow instance data cache expiration delay in seconds

name: cache-max
desc: maximum number of workflow instance cache entries

name: logdir
desc: sets log file directory

name: tibco-daemon
desc: default TIBCO daemon variable

name: tibco-network
desc: default TIBCO network value

name: tibco-service
desc: default TIBCO service value

name: tibco-timeout
desc: default TIBCO timeout value in ms

name: http-server
desc: network address on host for HTTP server (giving just a port number will bind to all interfaces)

name: http-secure-server
desc: network address on host for secure HTTP server (giving just a port number will bind to all interfaces)

name: http-secure-certificate
desc: file name of PEM certificate file for the secure (SSL-based) HTTP server

name: http-secure-private-key
desc: file name of PEM private key file for the secure (SSL-based) HTTP server, if the certificate does not include the private key

name: http-secure-private-key-password
desc: the password to the PEM private for the secure (SSL-based) HTTP server

name: instance-key
desc: key for this instance of Qorus

name: rbac-security
desc: Role-Based Access Control security for Qorus

name: rbac-force-user
desc: Force RBAC user based on source IP address or hostname, ex arg: 127.*=admin

name: option-file
desc: Path to the Qorus system option file (this option is only usable from the command-line)

name: dbparams-file
desc: Path to the Qorus system dbparams file to define datasource parameters

name: logfile-template
desc: template for system log file names

name: wf-logfile-template
desc: template for workflow log file names

name: svc-logfile-template
desc: template for service log file names

name: job-logfile-template
desc: template for job log file names

name: flush-status
desc: always flush status changes immediately to the DB, even when data remains cached (setting to True has a negative performance impact, setting to False does not affect workflow recoverabilty)

name: force-gui-encoding
desc: set to force XML-RPC responses to the Qorus GUI to have a specific character encoding

name: max-events
desc: maximum number of events to hold in the internal event cache

name: workflow-params
desc: each key in the hash specifies a workflow and option in the following format: <workflow-name>:<workflow-version>:<workflow-option>, note that <workflow-version> may be '*' (as long as the option is not a per-segment option), meaning all versions of a particular workflow match; <workflow-option> may be any option affecting workflow processing; note that per-segment options are specified as follows: <segmentid>/<option-name> where <segmentid> can be given by the step name and optional version: <stepname>[/<stepversion>] (in this case the workflow version must be given explicitly)

name: db-max-threads
desc: maximum allowed DB threads for parallelized tasks (ex: session recovery); typically the system schema DB server's CPU count + 2; must be less than system-pool-maximum

name: remoteconnections-file
desc: Path to the Qorus system remoteconnections file to define remote Qorus instances

name: audit
desc: list of objects to audit, elements may be: '*' (enable everything), 'system' (system events), 'workflows' (workflow start & stop events), 'workflow-data' (events related to workflow order data processing), 'jobs' (job start & stop events), 'job-data' (events related to job instance processing), 'services' (service events), 'api' (audit api calls that make changes), 'api-read' (audit api calls that only return information), 'user-events' (audit user events), 'oload' (audit oload code loading events), 'alerts' (audit alert events), 'groups' (audit group status changes)

name: info-snapshot
desc: Maximum number of days for using live data when retrieving workflow or job instances status overview information from the info service; if a query requires summary data older than this number of days then the materialized views will be used instead of a live query for performance reasons; set to 0 to disable and always use a live query. This option is useful for Qorus installations with a very large number of workflow order instances online where summary queries could take a considerable amount of time. Use schema-tool -s to update the materialized views.

name: max-service-threads
desc: maximum amount of threads a Qorus service can start

name: compat-strict-bool-eval
desc: if the %strict-bool-eval parse option should be set on all user code in the Qorus instance for backwards compatibility with Qorus before 2.7.0.p3

name: compat-string-numbers
desc: if the "string-numbers" option should be set on all user datasources that support this option for backwards compatibility with Qorus before 2.7.0.p3

name: rbac-external
desc: module names for external RBAC authentication

name: debug-system
desc: turns on Qorus system debugging

name: defines
desc: defines for Qorus user code

name: auto-error-update
desc: allows workflow error definitions to be updated automatically based on the workflow's error definition function

name: compat-http-utf8
desc: forces any HTTP text message bodies to be tagged with UTF-8 encoding if no charset specification is present

name: transient-alert-max
desc: maximum number of transient alerts stored in Qorus

name: alert-smtp-connection
desc: the connection name for the SMTP server for alert email delivery

name: alert-smtp-to
desc: email recipient 'To:' list for alerts

name: alert-smtp-from
desc: email recipient 'From:' value for alerts

name: alert-smtp-interval
desc: alert email coalescing interval in seconds

name: alert-smtp-enable
desc: enable alert emails; this property is runtime changeable

name: alert-fs-full
desc: raise an ongoing alert if a monitored filesystem is greater than the given percentage full

name: sql-default-blocksize
desc: Size of the regular session recovery and workflow startup SQL batches

name: sql-init-blocksize
desc: Size of the first workflow startup SQL batch for instant workflow instance processing as soon as possible

name: connection-modules
desc: module names for externally-defined connection handling

name: dsp-warning-timeout
desc: the connection acquisition timeout threshold in milliseconds for raising transient alerts against DatasourcePool objects

name: dsp-error-timeout
desc: the connection acquisition timeout threshold in milliseconds for DatasourcePool objects for raising exceptions

name: manage-interfaces
desc: start and stop interfaces depending on their connection status

name: socket-warning-timeout
desc: the socket operation timeout threshold in milliseconds for raising transient alerts against socket-based connection objects

name: socket-min-throughput
desc: the minimum socket throughput in bytes/second below which a warning will be raised for socket-based connection objects

name: socket-min-throughput-ms
desc: the minimum time in milliseconds a socket transfer must take for it to be eligible for throughput warnings; transfers that take less time than this are ignored

name: autostart-interfaces
desc: allows workflows, services, and jobs to be started when the system starts

name: service-perf-events
desc: enables SERVICE_METHOD_PERFORMANCE event emission on all service calls; note that enabling this option can cause service method call performance degredation

name: workflow-step-perf-events
desc: enables WORKFLOW_STEP_PERFORMANCE event emission for all workflow steps; note that enabling this option can cause workflow step performance degredation
